#summary How to install EMFPath library

= Eclipse Installation =

== Open the Install New Software ==

It is available from the help menu.

http://img409.imageshack.us/img409/6371/install0.jpg

It shows a window similar to the following one.

http://img245.imageshack.us/img245/3627/install1x.jpg

== Add Guava update site (EMFPath dependency)  ==

The P2 repository URL is http://svn.codespot.com/a/eclipselabs.org/guava-bundle/trunk/repository/

http://img444.imageshack.us/img444/1918/install3l.jpg

== Adding EMFPath update site  ==

The P2 repository URL is http://svn.codespot.com/a/eclipselabs.org/emfpath/trunk/repository/

http://img412.imageshack.us/img412/3429/install2k.jpg

== Install the EMFPath library ==

You will have to choose between Runtime or SDK. The difference is that the SDK includes source and Javadoc.

http://img16.imageshack.us/img16/6026/install4.jpg

If you want Guava sources, you have to install the Guava SDK by selecting the Guava update site in the first combo box.
